reviews.review_msg: Lisa is a passionate and knowledgeable professor. While word around campus and here is negative, I've had nothing but great classes with her. Helpful, informative and interesting lectures, and a great marker with good feedback. She's friendly, but if you are annoying or say dumb things, she will let you know. She's now Dean at McGill

The other reviews are crazy! logic is hard but Nic is great! This was not a logic course but was one of the best I have ever taken. Nic is hilarious, understanding, and a fantastic instructor. He goes through the material slowly and is always accessible outside of class. He truly cares about his students and it shows. Definitely recommend
The man's a born lecturer. The course was on Kant, so brutally difficult, but his  passion and knowledge on the topic made it more than bearable. Go to his office hour. It'll help you a lot.

Course was about as difficult as it could possibly get, and his grading contributed to that, but hes an amazing prof.  Hes a great lecturer, and hes pretty approachable and helpful if you go to him for extra help with your writing (which is quite advisable).  Overall though, it was a really interesting course, and hes a great guy.

If you seek good classroom discussion or deep textual analysis in an upper level PHIL class, avoid at all costs. In discussion, Dr. McPherran is content to give short answers that stop any subsequent questioning, rather than follow along with students' lines of thought; as a consequence, neither deep thinking nor good discussion is achieved.
